title: Gulf company to build 4.5-bn euro Bosnian 'tourist city'
text:

A Dubai-based developer signed a 4.5 billion Euro ($5.1 billion) contract on Thursday to build a 'tourist city' in Bosnia.
The country has become a magnet for investment from the UAE with Buroj Property Development planning to build thousands of homes, several hotels, a shopping mall and a hospital in the municipality of Trnovo.
The city is ideally located at the foot of Bjelasica, one of four mountains surrounding the capital Sarajevo.
A Dubai-based developer signed a 4.5 billion Euro ($5.1 billion) contract on Thursday to build a 'tourist city' in Bosnia
Work on the complex, where a three-bedroom villa will cost $358,000 (£231,781), is set to begin in April.
'This is my life project and I hope that we will finish it without delay', the company's president Ismail Ahmed said at the signing ceremony.

The Balkans country of 3.8 million people, 40 percent of whom are Muslims, has registered a significant increase in visitors from Gulf states such as UAE, Qatar and Saudi Arabia in recent years.
Buroj Property Development is planning to build thousands of homes, several hotels, a shopping mall and a hospital in the municipality of Trnovo
The city is ideally located at the foot of Bjelasica, one of four mountains surrounding the capital Sarajevo
Construction on the complex will begin in April 2016 and is expected to be completed by the end of that year
Inside the development, a three-bedroom villa is expected to cost $358,000 (or about £231,781)
The 'tourist city' is simply the latest in a series of large property projects by UAE investment companies
The 'tourist city' is the latest in a series of large property projects by Gulf companies.
A tourist resort built by a Kuwaiti investor around 30 kilometres (18 miles) from Sarajevo is scheduled to open on Saturday.
Elsewhere, a Saudi company is building a new residential area comprising more than 200 villas in the hills of Sarajevo.
The project is slated for completion by the end of 2016.
